intro: Therofon turbinatum, commonly known as the turban snail, is a species of air-breathing land snail. It belongs to the family Achatinellidae and is characterized by its large, spiral-shaped shell. The shell is typically reddish-brown with a smooth surface and a thick, conical shape. This species is native to Hawaii and is found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Due to habitat loss and introduced predators, it is considered endangered and is a subject of conservation efforts.
